title: JetBlue flight from Newark makes emergency landing at JFK after crew reports smoke in the cockpit
text:
A JetBlue Airways flight from Newark to Orlando was forced to make an emergency landing at John F. Kennedy International Airport on Sunday night.

Crew aboard JetBlue flight 227 reported smoke in the cockpit of the Airbus A320 aircraft just minutes after take-off at Newark, declaring an emergency to air traffic control.

The flight had been bound for Orlando International Airport but the plane landed at JFK shortly after 7:30pm yesterday night.

Crew aboard JetBlue flight 227 reported smoke in the cockpit of the Airbus A320 aircraft just minutes after take-off at Newark, declaring an emergency to air traffic control (File photo)

The Federal Aviation Administration say they’re investigating the incident.

In a statement, a JetBlue spokesperson told DailyMail.com the crew noticed an electrical smell inside the cockpit, in addition to the smoke.

Passengers aboard the aircraft were transferred onto another plane and continued on to Orlando.
description: Crew aboard JetBlue flight 227 reported smoke in the cockpit of the Airbus A320 aircraft just minutes after take-off at Newark on Sunday, declaring an emergency to air traffic control.
